description: This file contains C source code implementations for constructing, formatting, and destroying sensor-related messages (such as add, remove, update, fault/restore events) within a sensor management system. It includes functions for creating message objects, formatting sensor data into strings, and cleaning up allocated resources.

methods.name: icStringBuffer * formatSensorCrudMessageFormatter(message * msg,samplePayloadFormat format)
methods.description: Formats sensor data into a string buffer for sending, including device ID, endpoint ID, label, type, faulted/troubled status, manufacturer, model, and serial number.

methods.name: void sensorCrudMessageDestroyFunc(message * msg)
methods.description: Cleanup function to free resources associated with a sensor message, including destroying the Sensor object and the internal sample message.

methods.name: icStringBuffer * formatSensorRemoveMessageFormatter(message * msg,samplePayloadFormat format)
methods.description: Formats a sensor removal message, primarily including the endpoint ID of the sensor that was removed.

methods.name: void sensorRemoveMessageDestroyFunc(message * msg)
methods.description: Cleanup function to free resources associated with a sensor removal message, including freeing the endpoint ID string.

methods.name: message * createSensorAddedMessage(Sensor * sensor)
methods.description: Creates a message indicating a new sensor has been added, embedding the Sensor object.

methods.name: message * createSensorRemovedMessage(char * sensorEndpointId)
methods.description: Creates a message indicating a sensor has been removed, embedding the endpoint ID.

methods.name: message * createSensorUpdatedMessage(Sensor * sensor)
methods.description: Creates a message indicating a sensor was updated (similar to add in this sample).

methods.name: message * createSensorFaultRestoreMessage(Sensor * sensor)
methods.description: Creates a message indicating a sensor has reported a fault or has been restored (similar to add in this sample).
